Title: The Name of the Wind
Summary: Kvothe, a gifted young man with a tragic past, recounts his life story from humble beginnings in a traveling troupe to his years at a magical university. He is driven by the need to uncover the truth behind the mythical Chandrian, the mysterious beings responsible for the murder of his family. Through music, magic, and hardship, Kvothe carves a name for himself in a world filled with legends, dangers, and secrets.

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Summary: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is hired by a wealthy industrialist to solve the decades-old disappearance of his niece. With the help of Lisbeth Salander, a brilliant but troubled hacker, they uncover a twisted web of family secrets, violence, and corruption. As the mystery deepens, both are forced to confront demons from their own pasts.

Title: Dune
Summary: Set in a distant future where noble houses control planetary fiefdoms, Dune tells the story of Paul Atreides, heir to the House Atreides. When his family is betrayed and destroyed over the desert planet Arrakis—a vital source of the universe's most valuable substance, the spice—Paul must survive in the harsh wastelands, embrace a destiny foretold in prophecy, and rise as a messianic leader to reclaim his birthright.

Title: The Rosie Project
Summary: Don Tillman, a brilliant professor of genetics, sets out to find a wife using a strict questionnaire to filter candidates. His logical world is upended when he meets Rosie, a spontaneous and free-spirited bartender who is on a quest to find her biological father. Despite being the antithesis of his ideal partner, Rosie challenges Don’s perceptions of love, compatibility, and what truly matters in relationships.

Title: The Southern Book Club’s Guide to Slaying Vampires
Summary: A group of suburban housewives in 1990s South Carolina forms a book club as an escape from their mundane lives. When a mysterious man moves into the neighborhood and children begin to go missing, the women suspect something sinister. Combining horror and humor, this novel is a blood-soaked tribute to female friendship and suburban strength.

Title: The Nightingale
Summary: In Nazi-occupied France, two sisters, Vianne and Isabelle, must survive the horrors of war in different ways. Vianne tries to keep her daughter safe while Isabelle joins the resistance, risking her life to save others. Their courageous stories illuminate the often-overlooked sacrifices of women during wartime.

Title: A Man Called Ove
Summary: Ove is a curmudgeonly old man with staunch principles, strict routines, and a short fuse. When a new family moves in next door and accidentally flattens his mailbox, it begins a transformation. Through laughter, grief, and unexpected friendship, Ove's life becomes a tender tale of rediscovery and hope.

Title: Mexican Gothic
Summary: Noemí Taboada, a glamorous debutante, is sent to check on her cousin in a crumbling, eerie mansion. What she discovers is a haunting blend of fungus, ghosts, and ancient curses tied to a sinister family legacy. This novel is a chilling Gothic horror wrapped in rich Mexican folklore and style.

Title: Six of Crows
Summary: In the bustling city of Ketterdam, criminal prodigy Kaz Brekker assembles a team of outcasts for an impossible heist. Each member carries a dark past and deadly skills. As they infiltrate a fortified stronghold, bonds form and secrets unravel in this thrilling fantasy adventure.

Title: Neuromancer
Summary: Case, a washed-up hacker, is hired for a final job by a mysterious employer with vast resources. Set in a dystopian cyber-future, the novel explores AI, consciousness, and the limits of reality as Case dives into cyberspace one last time.

Title: Uprooted
Summary: Agnieszka is chosen to serve the Dragon, a wizard who protects her village from the corrupted Wood. As she discovers her own magical abilities, she must confront the spreading darkness threatening to consume the land. This is a story of wild, untamed magic and the strength of a stubborn heart.

Title: The Lincoln Lawyer
Summary: Defense attorney Mickey Haller runs his law practice from the backseat of his Lincoln. When he takes on a high-profile client, a wealthy man accused of assault, he finds himself entangled in a dangerous game of deceit and murder.

Title: Behind Closed Doors
Summary: To the outside world, Jack and Grace Angel are the perfect couple—he’s a successful lawyer, she’s a charming hostess. But behind locked doors lies a harrowing reality, as Grace struggles to escape a marriage that is a living nightmare.

Title: The Overstory
Summary: Intertwining stories of nine strangers connected by trees, this novel explores how humans and nature are deeply interdependent. A sweeping ecological epic that challenges readers to reconsider their relationship with the natural world.

Title: Rebecca
Summary: A young woman marries a wealthy widower and moves to his estate, only to find herself haunted by the memory of his glamorous first wife, Rebecca. As she uncovers disturbing truths, she must confront the past to claim her place in the present.

Title: Eleanor Oliphant is Completely Fine
Summary: Eleanor leads a solitary, routine life, hiding emotional scars from her past. A chance encounter with a coworker draws her into a new world of friendship and healing. This is a story of loneliness, resilience, and the transformative power of kindness.

Title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
Summary: Henrietta Lacks, a poor Black woman, unknowingly became the source of the first immortal human cells used in medical research. This compelling biography delves into her legacy, the ethics of science, and the impact on her family.

Title: The Shadow of the Wind
Summary: In post-war Barcelona, young Daniel discovers a mysterious novel in a hidden library. As he searches for the truth behind the author’s disappearance, he uncovers a tale of passion, revenge, and lost love echoing through time.

Title: Like Water for Chocolate
Summary: Tita’s emotions infuse her cooking with magical consequences in this tale of forbidden love and family tradition. Each chapter, paired with a recipe, serves as a window into her struggles with love, loss, and rebellion.

Title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
Summary: A man returns to his childhood home and recalls strange, magical events involving a neighbor girl and ancient forces. Blending memory, myth, and melancholy, this tale explores the fragility of innocence and the endurance of wonder.
